page.title: 03DAIRY FARMERS AND THE EEC.
page.content: A major problem for dairy farmers in this area came when EEC quotas were brought in overnight in April 1984 with no warning. It was stated that only the same amount of milk produced in 1983 would be allowed to be produced, less 9%. Many farmers had to reduce their herds and others who were in the middle of expanding were left with various bills to pay and no need for the expansion. Many went bankrupt and had to sell. Dairy farmers turned to beef and sheep farming and tourism as alternatives. A levy of 2p a litre was introduced should the farmers exceed their quota. Some farmers have over-produced and others under-produced so that at present it is balanced.
